comment: Garbage. Can't even get passed the welcome message.

reply.content: Michael, thank you for review. Please install Informer on your phone. If your watch is Android Wear 2.0 then install Informer on your watch from the list called "Installed on the phone" in the Play Market app. Contact support@komparato.com for assistance.

author: Jon Almond
comment: One further question is it possible to reply using an android wear keyboard or just by voice/preset messages

reply.author: Komparato
reply.content:
Jon, thank you for review. You are right. We need a tutorial or make the interface more intuitive. Tick ✅ button marks a message as read and dismisses the notification on the phone. Cross ❌button just closes the instant card on the watch leaving the original notification untouched. 
Virtual keyboard support is on the roadmap.

reply.author: Komparato

comment: Great app works well

reply.author: Komparato
reply.content: Thank you for review and rating! 🎄 Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year!

author: Kip Mast
comment: Pretty nice app. With newest update it doesn't send my reply responses.  Example: When I receive a BBM message the InformerWear card pops up on my watch and I have a option to respond via the Mic icon,. after I record my message the text box dissappears so I tap on the green "check" icon which I assume sends the reply and closes the card?  Nothing ever gets sent I'm noticing.  I've tried this on two separate androidwear watches, one with AW1.5 the other with AW 2.0.  Am I  using the reply function properly?? Update: Thanks for the reply- I will play around with it some more-

reply.author: Komparato
reply.content: Thank you for using Informer. Green tick ✅ button marks the message as read which dismisses the original notification from the phone. If you want to send the reply just press the button with text of reply. When you use voice recognition then the very top reply button should contain the recognized text. Contact support@komparato.com for assistance

author: Paul Quinn
comment: The app itself deserved 4-5 stars. I'll say that right up front. But... the pricing structure to fully enable the app is just ridiculous. I am always one to buy apps. Support developers! Even if it's an app that works fine as free, I still usually do the in-app purchase or buy the paid version if I really like the app. This one though - $10? It's an excellent add-on for messaging on your watch.but $10 in the app world puts it up there with an Exchange email client like Nine. Full featured launchers don't cost $10. The 99 cent subscription model makes no sense. Why would this be a subscription app?  A developer can charge whatever they want but I can have an opinion. Placing the full feature set under such an out of line price detracts from the app. I bet more people would buy it if it were priced under $4. More people paying probably leads to more money than a few paying $10. I just can't bring myself to pay that. I hope the developer rethinks the price. Then, I might buy it.

reply.author: Komparato
reply.content: Paul, thank you for review. We are doing our best to deliver new functions and bring delightful user experience. Premium membership payments indicate whether we are going in the right direction or not. Quality should not be cheap. Consider that you are hiring us to develop this application for you. You can fire us by cancelling your subscription.
